name: Netherlands Chamber of Commerce (Kamer van Koophandel)
memberOrga: The Netherlands Chamber of Commerce manages the Dutch Business Register with 2,7 million registered companies.
goal:
The Netherlands Chamber of Commerce

The Netherlands Chamber of Commerce is a modern public service provider dedicated to make life easier for entrepreneurs by providing useful information. The Chamber of Commerce manages the national business
register and offers reliable information on every company, enhancing legal certainty in doing business.

Through the knowledge, data and networks of the Chamber of Commerce, entrepreneurs are provided with
objective information and advice on business start-up and transfer, growth, finance, internationalisation and
innovation.

The Netherlands Chamber of Commerce has 19 offices across the country and approximately 1500 employees.

Main tasks:
• Managing the business register
• Providing information, advice and support to business (e.g. business start-up, finance, internationalisation,
innovation)
• Manager & developer of (digital) business plazas
• Innovation promotion
• Promotion of regional economic development
• Export documents and other services

Main facts & figures 2017:
• 27,8 million visits to www.kvk.nl (chamber website)
• 5,6 million visits to ondernemersplein.nl (Digital Entrepreneurs Plaza)
• A business register with 2,7 million registered companies
• Over 1 million customer contacts/questions per year via web, socials, chat, telephone, email and desks
• A Business Panel with 4.000 entrepreneurs
• 276.000 newsletter subscribers
• 820.000 issued export documents
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives:
- Internal Market, Industry, Enterpreneurship and SMEs
- Digital Single Market & Digital Economy
- Justice (e.g. company Law, data protection/privacy)
- Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union (e.g. EMIR, MIFID, MIFIR related to LEI)
- Innovation
- Better Regulation
- Customs
